doc.field: Records of the Institute of African American Affairs
Records of the Institute of African American Affairs
Series II. Association for Education in Journalism (AEJ)
Series II. Association for Education in Journalism (AEJ)

In 1970, Founding IAAA Director Dr. Roscoe C. Brown Jr. and Dr. Lionel Barrow, Dean of Howard University School of Communications, created the Association for Education in Journalism Summer Internship Program for Minorities. This series includes files related to the administration of the AEJ internship program dating from 1970 to 1993. Files typically include correspondence, class arrangements, finances, forms, reports, magazines, and individual files on interns and finalists of the program.
